乁字的基本解释

乁
yí
古同“移”。

乁
jí
古同“及”。

乁字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fú］
［《廣韻》敷勿切，入物，敷。］
《说文·丿部》：“从反丿。讀與弗同。”段玉裁注：“自左而曲於右……音義略同拂。書家八法谓之磔。”现代汉字笔形之一，称“捺”。

乁字的康熙字典解释

【子集上】【丿字部】　乁； 康熙笔画：2； 页码：页81第09
【唐韻】弋支切【集韻】余支切，?音移。【說文】流也。从反。【字彙】闕乁不載。【正字通】丿乀乁見《說文》。趙古則定爲撆拂抴迻四字，魏校、吳元滿諸家各有解詁，獨《戴侗·六書統》釋曰：古今書傳未常用此文，凡書方圜曲直，左右抴引，皆因其形勢之自然，初不成文，豈有定名。按此說，四文與丨丶同類，備偏旁畫母也，故《正韻》?削之。

"Shuowen·Feibu": "Congfanfen. Reading and Futong." Duan Yucai's note: "From the left to the right... the sound and meaning are slightly the same. The calligrapher's eight methods are called "Zhong"." Modern Chinese character strokes One is called "捺".

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset Part 1] [Feng Zi Department] 　乁; Kangxi Strokes: 2; Page Number: Page 81 09
[Tang Yun] Yi branch cut [Ji Yun] remaining branch cut, sound shifted. [Said Wen] Liu Ye. From the reverse . [Vocabulary] Que Qi does not contain. [Zhengzitong] 丿乀乁 See "Shuowen". Zhao Gu is determined to be the four characters of 撆, 抴抴shift, Wei Xiao and Wu Yuanman have their own interpretations, and the interpretation of "Dai Tong·Liu Shu Tong" says: this text is not commonly used in ancient and modern books. Because of the nature of its situation, it was unwritten at the beginning, so how can it be named. According to this, the four texts are of the same kind as 丨, and they are also prepared for the original painting mother, so "Zhengyun" is cut off.
